summaryText: Today, Pastor Travis Hearn delivered an incredibly powerful and hope-filled message about overcoming life's giants! Drawing from Isaiah 43, PT shared his personal journey of surviving a brain bleed and stroke, transforming a potentially devastating medical diagnosis into a testimony of God's miraculous power. The sermon, titled 'This Is What the Lord Says', was a passionate reminder that no matter what voices of fear, doubt, or discouragement we hear, God's word and promise are ultimately supreme. Pastor Travis used the story of David and Goliath to illustrate how courage isn't the absence of fear, but our response to it. He brilliantly compared Christians to either eagles or chickens - those who soar above challenges versus those who remain ground-bound by fear. The most profound moment? When he declared that God doesn't just deliver us FROM fires, but walks WITH us THROUGH them. His personal testimony of medical professionals saying his condition was 'irreversible', contrasted with his declaration that 'God reverses the irreversible', was spine-tingling and faith-building. This sermon wasn't just a message - it was a powerful declaration of hope, resilience, and God's unbreakable promises!
mainPoints: Do not fear - God is with you
You are going to get through this challenge
God will go through the challenge with you

versesMentioned.text: But now, this is what the Lord says—he who created you, Jacob, he who formed you, Israel: 'Do not fear, for I have redeemed you; I have summoned you by name; you are mine. When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.'
So shall my word be that goes forth from my mouth; it shall not return to me empty, but it shall accomplish what I please, and it shall prosper in the thing for which I sent it.
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.

David asked the men standing near him, 'What will be done for the man who kills this Philistine and removes this disgrace from Israel? Who is this uncircumcised Philistine that he should defy the armies of the living God?'
Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all his benefits—
I will remember the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago.
But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.

The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters, he refreshes my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his name's sake. Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me. You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows. Surely your goodness and love will follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.
I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me—
My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 41:10: 'So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.'
Monday.focus: Identifying current fears and surrendering them to God
Monday.action: Make a list of your current fears. Next to each fear, write a declaration of faith and trust in God's ability to overcome that fear.
Monday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my fears to You. Give me the courage to trust You completely, even when circumstances seem overwhelming. Help me to focus on Your promises instead of my fears. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Tuesday.focus: Recognizing God's strength in our weaknesses
Tuesday.action: Identify one personal challenge you're currently facing. Journal about how God might be using this challenge to develop your spiritual strength.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord, transform my perspective on my current challenges. Help me see them as opportunities for growth and spiritual development. Fill me with Your supernatural strength today. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Joshua 1:9: 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.'
Wednesday.action: Do one thing today that scares you, trusting God's presence and strength will carry you through.
Wednesday.prayer: God, give me boldness and courage today. Help me step out in faith, knowing that You are always with me. Replace my fear with trust and confidence in Your plan. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 4:16-18: 'Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day.'
Thursday.action: Create a 'miracle journal' documenting past ways God has been faithful in your life. Review this journal when facing current challenges.
Thursday.prayer: Father, remind me of Your faithfulness. Help me focus on Your promises instead of my problems. Renew my hope and strengthen my faith today. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Friday.focus: Finding comfort in God's presence during difficult times
Friday.action: Reach out to someone going through a challenging season. Offer genuine encouragement and prayer support.
Friday.prayer: Lord, use me as an instrument of Your comfort and hope. Help me see others' pain and respond with Your love and compassion. Give me wisdom to support those around me. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection, asking God to reveal how He might be working in your current challenges. Write down potential ways God could be transforming your situation.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I trust Your plan, even when I cannot see it. Help me believe that You are working all things together for my good. Give me patience and faith to wait on Your perfect timing. Amen.
